page.title: 08PENN STREET CHURCH
page.content: The church was built by the first Earl Howe in 1849.It has flints in the walls,and an usual shingled spire. Our school comes to services here for harvest festival, Christmas, Ascencion Day etc. Rev: Stowe (who is also a governor of our school),told us its history. At the back there is a huge copy of Raphael's Transfiguration which came from Earl Howe's chapel in Curzon St:, London. It was too big to get through the door, and had to come in through a stained glass window. A mother from our school has designed the 150 tapestry kneelers, which were made by the congregation. They include Bible fruit, festivals, flowers, local clubs, and the Curzon coat-of-arms. There is a model of the church made in matchsticks. We saw the Burial and Baptism Registers.
